bibl.title: Letter from Elbert DeCoursey to Philip Showalter Hench, November 13, 1953

div1.p: DeCoursey informs Hench that the "The Military Surgeon" is interested in doing an article on the Camp Lazear dedication. He congratulates Hench on his efforts to collect Reed memorabilia and hopes that Hench keeps the Medical Museum in mind if he ever disposes of any of the material.

div1.head: Letter from Elbert DeCoursey to Philip Showalter Hench, November 13, 1953
div1.opener:
ADDRESS ALL COMMUNICATIONS TO THE DIRECTOR
ARMED FORCES INSTITUTE OF PATHOLOGY
7TH STREET AND INDEPENDENCE AVENUE SW.
WASHINGTON 25, D. C.
13 November 1953
DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
MEDEM-M-700
DEPARTMENT OF PATHOLOGY
AMERICAN REGISTRY OF PATHOLOGY
EDeC/mek
MEDICAL MUSEUM
MEDICAL ILLUSTRATION SERVICE
Philip S. Hench, M. D.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for the reprint telling the story
of Camp Lazear.

The Editorial Office of “The Military Surgeon”, which
is located in the same building with us, has indicated an
interest in an article on the dedication of Camp Lazear,
and we hope that you will write and publish such a paper.

You are to be congratulated on your untiring efforts
to collect Walter Reed memorabilia, and we hope that you
will keep the Medical Museum of the Armed Forces Institute
of Pathology in mind should you ever consider disposition
of any of this material.

closer.signed:
ELBERT DeCOURSEY
Brig Gen, MC, USA
The Director
